Cast: Various people appear as themselves, including Melvin Van Peebles and Bill Cosby.
Reception: The film received mostly positive reviews, with a 91% rating on Rotten Tomatoes and a 75/100 on Metacritic.[2][3] Roger Ebert of the Chicago Sun-Times named it one of the best films of the year.[4] Baadasssss! was nominated for several "best of" Independent Spirit and NAACP Image awards for 2005, including best feature, director, actor and screenplay. It was listed in the African-American Film Critics Association's top-ten films of 2004 and won best feature film at the 2004 Philadelphia Film Festival.[5] However, the film ended up being a commercial failure, making less than $400,000 at the box office during its limited theatrical release.[1]
